exercises.name: Barbell Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell racked at shoulder height
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width with palms facing forward
Unrack and hold the bar at collarbone level, elbows slightly in front of the bar
Brace your core and squeeze your glutes
Press the bar straight up, moving your head back slightly to clear the bar path
Lock out arms overhead with the bar directly over mid-foot
Lower the bar under control back to the starting position
cues: Keep your core tight throughout
Push your head through once the bar passes your forehead
Squeeze glutes to prevent lower back arch
Bar path should be straight up and down

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
instructions: Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height
Position dumbbells with palms facing forward, elbows bent at 90 degrees
Brace your core and press both dumbbells straight overhead
Bring dumbbells together at the top without clanking
Lower dumbbells back to shoulder height with control
cues: Keep wrists stacked over elbows
Don't let elbows flare too wide
Control the descent, don't drop the weights
Exhale as you press up

exercises.name: Kettlebell Overhead Press
instructions: Clean the kettlebell to the rack position at shoulder height
Keep the kettlebell close to your body with elbow tucked
Rotate your wrist as you press so your palm faces forward at the top
Lock out arm completely overhead
Reverse the motion to return to the rack position
cues: Keep the bell close to your centerline
Let the bell rotate naturally as you press
Engage your lat to stabilize the shoulder
Keep your core braced throughout

exercises.name: Arnold Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, dumbbells at shoulder height
Start with palms facing your body, like the top of a curl
As you press up, rotate your wrists so palms face forward at the top
Press until arms are fully extended overhead
Reverse the rotation as you lower back to start
cues: Smooth rotation throughout the movement
Don't rush the rotation, it happens throughout the press
Keep elbows from flaring too wide
Control the weight on the way down

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbell in each hand at your sides
Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout
Raise arms out to the sides until parallel to the floor
Pause briefly at the top
Lower with control back to starting position
cues: Lead with your elbows, not your hands
Don't swing or use momentum
Keep traps relaxed, don't shrug
Thumbs slightly down at the top to emphasize lateral delt

exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raise
instructions: Set cable to lowest position with single handle attachment
Stand sideways to the machine, grab handle with far hand
Keep slight bend in elbow, arm hanging in front of body
Raise arm out to the side until parallel to floor
Lower with control and repeat, then switch sides
cues: Constant tension throughout the movement
Don't lean away from the cable
Lead with the elbow
Control the negative portion

exercises.name: Resistance Band Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand on the center of a resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold a handle in each hand at your sides
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Lower with control back to start
cues: Band tension increases at the top, control it
Keep core tight to prevent swaying
Don't shrug your shoulders
Smooth controlled movement throughout

exercises.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells in front of thighs
Palms can face down or toward each other (neutral grip)
Keep slight bend in elbows
Raise one or both arms in front until parallel to floor
Lower with control and repeat
cues: Don't swing the weights
Keep core braced to prevent leaning back
Stop at shoulder height, no higher needed
Alternate arms or do both together

exercises.name: Plate Front Raise
instructions: Stand holding a weight plate with both hands at 9 and 3 o'clock positions
Hold plate at thigh level with arms extended
Keep slight bend in elbows
Raise plate in front until arms are parallel to floor
Lower with control back to starting position
cues: Squeeze the plate tight throughout
Don't lean back as you raise
Control the descent
Keep shoulders down, don't shrug

exercises.name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Hold dumbbells and hinge at the hips until torso is nearly parallel to floor
Let arms hang straight down, palms facing each other
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Raise arms out to sides, squeezing shoulder blades together
Lower with control back to start
cues: Keep back flat, don't round
Lead with elbows, not hands
Squeeze at the top for a moment
Don't use momentum or swing

exercises.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Set cables at upper chest height with no attachments or rope handles
Stand centered between cables, grab left cable with right hand, right with left
Step back slightly, arms extended in front crossing over
Pull cables apart and back, keeping arms at shoulder height
Squeeze shoulder blades together at the end position
Return to start with control
cues: Keep slight bend in elbows
Don't shrug shoulders up
Focus on squeezing rear delts
Control the cables back to start

exercises.name: Reverse Pec Deck
instructions: Adjust the pec deck so handles are at shoulder height when seated facing the pad
Sit facing the machine, chest against the pad
Grip handles with arms extended in front
Open arms out to the sides, squeezing shoulder blades together
Return to start with control
cues: Keep chest pressed against pad
Don't use body momentum
Squeeze rear delts at the end range
Control the return phase

exercises.name: Cable Face Pull
instructions: Set cable at upper chest to face height with rope attachment
Grab rope with palms facing down, step back to create tension
Pull rope toward your face, separating hands as you pull
Pull until hands are beside your ears, elbows high and back
Squeeze shoulder blades together at the end
Return to start with control
cues: Keep elbows high throughout
Pull to your face, not your chest
External rotate at the end of the movement
Don't lean back excessively

exercises.name: Barbell Upright Row
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grip barbell with hands slightly narrower than shoulders
Let bar hang at arm's length in front of thighs
Pull bar straight up along your body, leading with elbows
Raise until bar reaches upper chest level, elbows pointing out and up
Lower with control back to start
cues: Keep the bar close to your body
Lead with elbows, not hands
Don't go too high if you feel shoulder impingement
Wider grip is easier on shoulders

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbell in each hand
Let dumbbells hang at arm's length in front of thighs, palms facing body
Pull dumbbells up along your body, leading with elbows
Raise until dumbbells reach upper chest level
Lower with control back to start
cues: More shoulder-friendly than barbell version
Keep dumbbells close to body
Lead with elbows
Stop if you feel any shoulder pinching

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrug
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbell in each hand at sides
Let arms hang fully extended, palms facing your body
Shrug shoulders straight up toward your ears
Hold briefly at the top
Lower with control back to start
cues: Straight up and down, no rolling
Don't bend elbows
Hold the squeeze at the top
Keep head neutral, don't jut chin forward

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell in front of thighs
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder width, arms fully extended
Shrug shoulders straight up toward ears
Hold briefly at the top
Lower with control back to start
cues: Keep arms straight throughout
Don't roll shoulders
Pause at the top for full contraction
Use straps if grip is limiting

exercises.name: Pike Push-Up
instructions: Start in a push-up position, then walk hands back and hips up into a pike/downward dog position
Hands shoulder-width apart, head between arms looking at feet
Bend elbows and lower head toward the floor between your hands
Push back up to the starting pike position
Keep hips high throughout the movement
cues: The steeper the pike, the harder the exercise
Head goes forward and down, not straight down
Keep core tight
Elbows track at 45 degrees, not flared

exercises.name: Wall Handstand Push-Up
instructions: Kick up into a handstand with your back facing the wall, heels resting on wall
Hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread wide
Brace core and squeeze glutes to maintain straight body line
Bend elbows to lower head toward the floor
Push back up to full arm extension
Start with partial range of motion and progress deeper
cues: Keep body tight like a plank
Head goes slightly forward as you descend
Don't arch lower back
Use a mat or pillow under head when learning

exercises.name: Band Pull-Apart
instructions: Hold resistance band in front of you at shoulder height with both hands
Arms extended, hands about shoulder-width apart on the band
Keep arms straight and pull the band apart by moving hands out to sides
Squeeze shoulder blades together at the end position
Return to start with control
cues: Keep arms at shoulder height throughout
Don't shrug shoulders
Squeeze shoulder blades together at the end
Control the return, don't let the band snap back

exercises.name: Landmine Press
instructions: Set up barbell in landmine attachment or wedged into a corner
Stand facing the end of the bar, grab it with one hand at shoulder height
Position feet staggered or square, core braced
Press the bar up and forward in an arc
Lower with control and repeat, then switch arms
cues: Arc path is easier on shoulders than straight overhead
Keep core tight to prevent rotation
Don't lean back excessively
Great for those with shoulder mobility issues
